newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine bourse approves Macondray IPO.
newsitem.headline: Philippine bourse approves Macondray IPO.

text.p: The Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) has approved the initial public offering of Macondray and Co Inc, one of the country's most diversified holding companies, a bourse official said on Wednesday.
PSE listing committee chairman Harry Liu told reporters that Macondray has passed all the financial and technical requirements to be able to offer its shares to the public.
The company is planning to offer 83 million to 191 million shares at a price range of 13.08 pesos to 22.44 pesos, which is equivalent to 11.5 times to 18 times 1997 earnings.
The proceeds will be used to repay debts as well as advances to its subsidiaries.
Macondray is the majority shareholder of Del Monte Pacific Resources Ltd which in turn owns 100 percent of Del Monte Philippines Inc, a major canned food and fruit company.
Macondray also owns a finance company, a distribution firm, an insurance broking firm, and packaging and plastic firms.
